Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Asking for a bit of advice really. I had a lumpectomy 5 weeks ago and margins came back clear thankfully. I've been back at work and not lifting or doing things to put my scar at risk. I've noticed this week my breast has been a bit painful which is a but of a shock as had no problems post op. Under my arm to the side of my breast where your bra strap goes around your back is tender to touch as is underneath my breast. My lump was removed from above my nipple. Also where the scar is it feels very hard and tender to touch. Where the scar is I presume is healing tissue or scar tissue. My concern is the other tender areas. I don't know if this is normal or if anyone who has had a lumpectomy has any experience of this. I was thinking about ringing my BC nurse on Monday. I have an apt on Tues to see the onchologist to discuss radiotherapy as my dcis was high grade. I've been taking ibuprofen most of the week as it is painful, not really bad but enough to warrant a painkiller. I've checked that my bra isn't too tight or where it is tender the underwire  isn't sticking in but neither is the case. I've also bought a bigger size back strap to ensure it isn't too tight. Hasn't made any difference. I know things were clear but slightly worried. Hope this is all normal healing procedures. Many thanks Sam x
Posts.Title: Tender. Breast

Posts.Content: Evening ladies.  Sorry to hear that your treatment isn't starting tomorrow Gablegirl. I'm not sure if I've done this correctly but could I join you lovely ladies as I start my rt on Thurs 5th at The Christie. I've had a WLE on 31st Jan and thankfully came back with clear margins. Was offered rt as was high grade DCiS. I start on 5th for 15 zaps.  Not really sure how I feel at the moment. I know I have made the right choice. I feel I need to try everything to hopefully with everything crossed I can help stop any reoccurrence. Keep telling everyone it will all be fine and I'm fine but had a bit of a wobble whilst in the shower this morning. I know I'm very very lucky and count my blessings everyday. Just wondering if it's normal? Sending much love to everyone Sam x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Jill, Thanks for best wishes. Brunch sounds lovely. I'm meeting a friend tomorrow for brunch, pancakes is something I don't usually have but might have to have. Enjoy the weekend. Just said to hubby my boob feels a bit hot. Put some aloe very gel on it but think it feels hot inside if that makes sense. Might do one and go and read my book as he has the golf on. I usually like the big majors but not until the last day which is Sunday. The build up before the cut is like watching paint dry lol. Sending love and hugs Sam x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thanks LeoLady, It is now in the fridge. Must tell my 18 yr old son who eats me out of house and home that it's not food lol. Thanks for advise. Love Sam x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Morning Jacqui, I started my rads last Thurs and was dreading it. It really was OK. Takes longer to set up the bed and scanner than doing it. First apt took longer as the double/triple check it is in the right place. You cannot feel anything. I didn't have a head/ chin strap. I had to lie on the bed and rest my right arm in support and head rested in head support. Perhaps that was just for the measuring apt although I didn't have it done then either? Please try not to worry. Just try and stay relaxed and think happy thoughts. It really is over before you can blink. Hope this helps x I bought some aloe vera gel from the health shop and on advice put it in the fridge. Lovely and cooling. My boob so far is OK and not changes colour or sore but only had 2 zaps. Hoping it continues. This week is the test as got the full 5/zaps. On Hols from school this week so resting up. Due to go back next week after easter hols but will see how I feel. I have an hour and 15 min journey there and the same back to hospital for apt. My head is brilliant and told me to see how I feel.  Sending love and hugs Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Apologises JayG x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Ginacarla, Many many congratulations to you on finishing rt. Hope you rang the bell loud and proud. Think my journey sounds very similar to yours. I'm 9/15 done today. Bet it feels surreal now its all over. Wishing you a very long happy and healthy life. Love and hugs Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Well the journey was not too bad at all thanks. Made it in good time too.  Glad to hear lots of zapping happening and all seem ok. Queenfisher the only thing I've used is aloe vera gel from Holland and Barratt. Very gentle as 99.7% just aloe vera. Even better when put in the fridge as suggested by the lovely Leolady. Touch wood only slight tanning so far. Might be worth a try. I'm on the last bit now had 10/15 so only 5 left to ringing the bell.  Love and hugs to everyone Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, Hope the ct scan went OK. Was this your planning appointment? Hope you get a date quickly. My planning apt was 23rd march bit I start 1/15 zaps at 4.30 today. With my experience everything seems to be 2 weeks between apts. I went back to work the day after my all clear but was lucky as I only had to work 2 days then the third day was an inset (I work in a school) then it was half term for a week. This is the first week  of 2 week Easter hols so again lucky I will get 1 and half weeks of treatment in the Hols. Planning to work morninings if I feel OK as I have asked to have apts in the afternoon. Hoping I'm not too tired as I have to go to The Christie in Manchester which is an hour and 15 there and back! Feeling a bit anxious but sure it will all be fine. I will feel better after I've been today and know what its like.  Sending lots of love to everyone.  Love Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Sorry Gablegirl But this has just made me laugh out loud. I'm currently having lunch in the cafe at the hospital after my zap and my mum pointed out the lovely pen marks that are clearly visible now in my v neck blouse! I feel your pain.  Fingers crossed for the job. Sending love and hugs Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Alison, Really sorry to hear you are feeling like this but glad you are strong and able to express how you are feeling. Good for you x.  You are right by spending time on yourself and healing yourself emotionally. Sending much love and hugs Love Sam x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thanks Gablegirl. Had 2nd zap today.  Feel OK but now feel a bit tired. Not sure if I'm just tired because I keep waking up at night or rads. Probs the poor sleep!  Glad you got sorted with apts. Good luck for Tues.  Love and hugs to everyone Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Aww Ange sorry to hear that you won't start till next week. Just been for a zap so going out for some lunch now. Well there has to be some benefits of BC. Might have a cake too lol. Sending lots of love Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Many many congratulations Ginacarla, Hope you rang the bell loud and proud. I think I will be in the same boat as you when I finish next wed. Bet it does feel strange but amazing in a good way too. Wishing you lots of love, luck and a very healthy life ahead of you. Love Sam x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Evening ladies. Thanks for the best wishes. Had my first zap today. We as a family had a lovely day out at quarry bank mill which is half an hour away from the hospital. My apt today wasnt until 4.30 so kept me.busy. Beautiful weather too was a bonus.  Well zap went well. Feel fine at the moment, thankfully. Won't take as long next time they told me as had to check all measurements. Going earlier tomorrow as apt is 2 hrs earlier. Got a nice sat evening  planned with friends and family. Still on Hols next week so that is good. Tried to change times for when I go back to work but can't other than 5 pm. Don't fancy that with Manchester traffic so leaving it as it is.  Sending love and hugs to everyone. Love Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Sorry you didn't get it Gablegirl. It is their loss and I'm sure something will turn up that is better than that one. Keeping everything crossed for you. Love Sam x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Jill, Had a nice weekend thanks. Boob settled down and felt OK. Didn't do pancakes where I went for brunch so had doorstep brown bread toast with poached egg. Was yummy. Had a good catch up with my friend. In the evening went to friends house there was 15 of us so had an Indian takeaway. Was delish and no cooking for me!.  Just waiting to go for 3rd zap . Need to get read as mum will be here in 50 mins to take me. Hubby at work so can't take me til Thurs then he is on a course Fri so one of my best mates is taking me. Hope you are well and enjoyed your weekend. X Love and hugs Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

First apt took longer as the double/triple check it is in the right place. You cannot feel anything. I didn't have a head/ chin strap. Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: LeoLady, Love it. Son would eat that in one sitting help from his 2 sisters lol.  X
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi lovely ladies, Wishing JacG good luck for planning meeting. queenfisher I would go tomorrow they will say yay or nay and you have to forget your manners when coughing don't put hand over your mouth.  I'm back at work today as been on Easter Hols from school. A lot harder this week as went to work this morning and got zapped 1.30. Takes 1 hr 15 to get there but had a lovely surprise today they are closing one of the main roads for resurfacing for 3 days this week. We have major road works by us and also close 2 main roads from wed too. My journey is turning into a nightmare now. Only 7 more zaps to go! Good luck everyone. Love and hugs Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi twinkle51 Sorry for late reply. I did write a long reply the next day but it disappeared from my phone before it posted. Was so cross with myself. Yes totally feel how you have felt twinkle. I feel numb, angry, emotional and feel I've lost all my confidence.  I'm sure it will get better just wish it would hurry up! Sending love and hugs Sam xxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Good morning lovely ladies, Wishing you a very happy birthday Pam. Hope after your zap you have a lovely day.  Hope everyone is OK and coping well, well as can be expected. I'm off for zap 5/15 today so third of the way through it now. Feel OK and boob not too bad. Feels a little toasty at night but OK. Did take bra off yesterday and was much more comfortable. I've only got small ones  and going through this has been an advantage as was able to find the lump and don't need to wear a bra for support. Never in my lift have I been grateful for small boobs lol. Aloe vera gel out of the fridge is lovely too. Good luck today with zaps. Sending lots of love and hugs. Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Queenfisher, Hope you got on OK with your zap. Shame about the aloe vera. Hope they sort your creams out or can give you an alternative. I've had aveeno cream which is plant based and is OK. Not sure of ingredients though as in the car. I can check tonight for you if that is any help Love and hugs Sam x
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Fantastic Twinkle, hope you rang that bell loud and proud. Can't wait to do it myself. Look after yourself and take each step one step at a time as they say. So very very pleased for you.  Love and hugs Sam xxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi katiepie, I'm a full time TA but also cover classes. I've been very lucky as had lumpectomy 31st Jan. Had 2 weeks off post op. Given all clear from high grade DCiS but offered radiotherapy due to high grade. Thankfully no chemo required.  I went back to work Wed/Thurs all day then Fri was inset. Followed by Feb half term. Back full time after Hols then started rt. I had 7/15 during Easter Hols. Back Mon morning then left for rt. Very busy traffic and lots of road closures this week! I'm working till almost lunchtime 11.30 but have to leave due to long journey to hospital. Had 9/15 today but must admit starting  to feel tired already. Maybe combination or rt/journey and going back to work. I've also been very well supported by school. Everyone has been amazing and looking after me. I'm also not going to be silly and if it gets too much I will take some time off but fingers crossed I can do this. Hope this helps and you get well supported as I'm sure you will. Love and hugs Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Queenfisher, Hope you managed to have rt this afternoon. Glad you have got some antibiotics, fingers crossed they help sort the cough quickly. Love and hugs Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Morning DohaYogi, I have used simple roll on deodorant. No one at any stage has told me not to wear it. I read in the booklet the hospital game me not to wear any deodorant containing aluminium. Think most sprays contain it. Have a great day everyone. Going for 10/15 later today so 2/3rd the way through now. Not looking forward to journey today ad lots of major roads to hospital close today. 2 for 3 months and 1 for 3 days. All part of the fun for me to find alternative route that won't hopefully impact on the already 1 and 15 journey! Hay ho setting off a bit earlier to be on the safe side and just hope the traffic won't be too much of a nightmare. Love and hugs to all Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Many thanks Karen, I'm going to give it a try but I'm a bit useless with computers so bare with me lol. Yes it worked lol Lots of love Sam xxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Thanks Jill and enjoy your weekend and spa day. No didn't refill as got work today. Not very professional going in to work with kids with a hangover. Saving that for the weekend. Jan hope the swelling has gone down. Good luck to everyone with their zaps. Will check in tonight to see how you are all getting on. Love and hugs Sam xxxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi Gablegirl, Well done on finishing your treatment. Sorry you had no bell to ring. Glad you enjoyed your cider. Hope it is OK after knee incident. Lots of love Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, Wow not been on for a few days. Glad everyone is OK ish, well as OK as you can with BC. Its my final zap tomorrow and not sure how I feel about it. I fear I'm going to be an emotional wreck. I feel really tired tonight but think its my emotions building. Heard lots of ladies talking about how they feel at the end. I've pushed through this working and travelling and don't want to let myself down by crying tomorrow. Plus my mum is taking me and I don't want to cry in front of her as I've said all along I'm fine, which I feel I have been. Bl##dy hate this feeling. I am such a strong personality and feel I've lost my confidence. Sorry feeling  a bit woe is me. I was given some hydrocortisone cream today as my nipple is driving me mad itching. Only started last night.  Good luck with the zaps. Love and hugs  Sam xx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi lovely ladies, Well I'm done and rang that bell. I must admit I was a bit emotional this morning before I went and when I rang the bell I had glistening eyes but held it together! I've had a glass of bubbles to celebrate but going to celebrate on Saturday as its my youngest daughters 14th birthday. I would like to thank you all for your support and I will be logging in daily to see how everyone is doing as well as being on the main BC forum. I wish you all well on your journey and cheers to you all. I wanted to add a photo but don't know how? Anyone know how to do it? Love and hugs Sam xxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: ☢☢☢ April 2018 Radiotherapy Club ☢☢☢

Posts.Content: Hi sortitout, Sending lots of love and keeping everything crossed for your results.  Sam x

Posts.Content: Oh no that's awful. Its the waiting that is the worse part of this rollercoaster. Sending lots of love Sam x
Posts.Title: Results day tomorrow - both hopeful and terrifirf

Posts.Content: Many thanks Leolady. Will have a look x
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Hi Jo, so pleased that your results came back clear. I hope you don't mind me asking. I had a lumpectomy on 31st and go for my results on 13th. Longest fortnight of my life! You said that your margines came back clear but what is the oncotype DX breast reaccurrance test you have to wait for. No one has said anything about this to me? I have no idea what all these initials and types are? Anyway keeping everything crossed for you too. Hope you enjoyed your wine. Definitely deserve it.  Lots of love Sam xxx
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy and sentinel node biopsy

Posts.Content: Hi Julie, Sorry to hear your diagnosis. You now know what you are up against and you are on your way to beat cancers @ss.  Sending love and hugs  Sam x

Posts.Content: Ruby Rose, So very very sorry for your loss. Sending the biggest hugs and lots of love to you and your family.  Love Sam x
